audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an upbeat male speaker welcoming the audience to another video. He excitedly informs viewers he will be surprising his girlfriend with her dream vacation for her birthday. The speaker details that his girlfriend has wanted to go to Jamaica for her birthday for the past three years. He states he is nervous, as this will be the first international vacation for them both.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating he got a haircut and was talking to his mom so Janise wouldn't see his text messages. He mentions booking a trip to Jamaica and dropping Janise off at her nail appointment. He plans to pick her up on camera and reveal a surprise at home, which is her birthday being in Jamaica. He expresses gratitude to viewers for their support, saying he wouldn't be able to do this without them and emphasizing how thankful he is. Then, he says he pulled up to his mom's house to chill with his grandfather while he waits for Janise's nail appointment to be done, and expresses nervousness for the video, encouraging viewers to engage. There are no notable background sounds.

The audio starts with a male voice directing someone to "run through the rain," noting blurriness. The male voice then expresses anticipation about something, followed by a female voice asking "Why are you recording?". The male voice responds in a light-hearted tone, saying "Get in the car Janice, it's wet.", followed by an acknowledgment from the female. There's a sound indicating a car door shutting. The male voice continues talking, saying he has a surprise at home, prompting curiosity and nervousness from the female. Rain sounds are consistently present in the background throughout the clip.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker, sounding excited, mentioning a "surprise" at the house and saying he will "show you" it. He adds that the listener will not "see it immediately", as he needs to "get it." A female speaker acknowledges with "okay". The male speaker asks "you ready", followed by another acknowledgment from the female. Then, there is nervous laughter from the female speaker. Finally, the sound of a dog barking is heard.

The audio begins with a male speaker excitedly explaining that he is about to show his wife, Jinise, a surprise. The woman can be heard laughing nervously in the background. The man instructs the woman to enter the room with her eyes closed and he rushes to prepare. The woman approaches while the man gives directions, joking about tripping over something. The man asks her to stay put as he prepares the surprise, and she says she's scared. On the count of three, the woman opens her eyes and immediately recognizes that the "surprise" is a goat, as she yells "I freaking knew it." The man laughs and asks how she knew. The woman explains that the other day, she noted that he never listens to her, even when she says that she wants to go somewhere. The man jokingly admits he does listen to her, but acts like he does not. The audio concludes with the woman exclaiming, "Oh my god."

The clip begins with a male speaker announcing a surprise about dates. In response, a woman expresses joy and excitement about this surprise, recognizing that it's near her birthday. The man confirms the dates, indicating they'll be in Jamaica, causing her to become ecstatic and emotional, shedding tears of gratitude. A brief moment of humor occurs when he playfully comments about her face and her hair getting in her mouth. Continuing her emotional reaction, she exclaims that this will be her first time leaving the country, a fact the man mentions in the introduction. The woman recalls her previous conversation about this to her nail technician. He announces their accommodations will be a master suite with a jacuzzi and an ocean view with a swim-up, plus food and drinks. The clip ends with the man encouraging her to "go wild" in Jamaica and with a sudden increase of the music followed by audio cut.

The audio clip starts with a female speaker asking what is meant by "fly". Another speaker, who is male, responds with "we're not taking no spirit airlines", specifying "not that spirit is bad, don't be afraid to take spirit. We just heard bad stories about them." A female speaker expresses feeling scared to fly. The male speaker reassures her "we're not on spirit", and continues with the statement "you're gonna go buck wild in Jamaica, you ready?". The female speaker reacts with "oh my god".

The audio begins with a male speaker explaining his surprise trip to Jamaica. He explains his reasons for prematurely revealing it, emphasizing that he knew she was on the verge of booking a trip herself. He recounts how she has mentioned wanting to go to Jamaica for the last 3 years. As he announces the trip, his tone is earnest and heartfelt. A female speaker exclaims in response with excitement. The male speaker then says he heard her and they will indeed be going to Jamaica in a month and a half. The clip concludes with a brief pause, followed by crying sounds presumably from the female speaker.

The audio opens with a male speaker encouraging someone to enjoy their birthday, declaring that this year will be different. The other speaker, presumably female, is emotional, expressing gratitude through tears. The male reassures her with affection, followed by her noting she usually feels depressed on her birthday. The male counters this year will be wild and fun, and he mentions showing her the room and an email with details, which he cannot share due to privacy concerns and fear of sabotage. The male speaker announces they're going to Jamaica in mid-March. The female expresses her amazement. The male reaffirms their trip will be great. The female notes 24 is her favorite number, and she expresses excitement for her 24th birthday. The male expresses agreement. The female speaker mentions lip gloss she intends to use. She describes the gloss as shiny and tingling.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker who sounds nervous, stating "with all that being said, that is it for today's video." He adds that he was nervous to bring something up to her, but did it anyway. He thought she wouldn't cry, but then she did "right at the very end," implying that this was a video about their relationship. He admits he's "kind of happy she cried," saying that's the only time he'll say that. He then gives a shout out to "you," says "you are heard," and that he listens "all the time," though he sometimes pretends not to. He ends the clip by asking viewers to like and comment. The segment is punctuated by light pop music with a positive mood, mainly featuring keyboard and synth sounds.
